div.head: VSim Downloads
div.p: VSim was designed so that it could be used as a platform to peer review, publish, and broadly disseminate academically generated 3D content. The NEH-funded VSim prototype was first released in 2013. The most recent is VSim 1.2.1 for Windows. This version can also be used on a dual-boot Mac or through Windows emulating software (e.g., Parallels). The prototype was built as a proof-of-concept to allow the VSim team to assess the educational possibilities of three-dimensional content and the software's functionality. Development is underway on an enhanced version of the software, which will be available on this page as soon as it is fully tested.

div.hi: Directions for installing the VSim prototype on Windows systems

list.item: Create a VSim folder on your hard drive
Right click on the links and ‘save link as ...’ the software, sample model, and other files as desired
Unzip the VSim .zip file (typically a right click, choose WinZip from the menu, and ‘extract to here’)
Navigate into the release folder and double click the VSim.exe file to launch the software
To begin using VSim, click File -> Open Model and browse for your downloaded 3D content
Read the user guide for help loading models and creating narratives of your own!
